alert.note: Alert for Warren (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 6:56PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Warren County through 745 PM EDT... At 655 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rossville, or 16 miles north of Danville, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Warren County, including the following locations... West Lebanon, Foster, Pence and State Line City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
